conclusion: State A: p_A = 1.0 × 10⁵ Pa, V_A = 6.0 × 10⁻³ m³
State B: p_B = 2.0 × 10⁵ Pa, V_B = 5.0 × 10⁻³ m³
For a fixed mass of ideal gas, p V/T is constant: p_A V_A / T_A = p_B V_B / T_B
Convert T_A to kelvin: T_A = 27 °C + 273 = 300 K
The temperature of the gas in state B is about 5.0 × 10² K (≈ 227 °C)
